storyInfo: After the ducal alliance enters the city, Ch'en finally locates Reunion in Londinium, now led by Nine. Reunion saves some innocents affected by the war, and also hears a call to rise up and resist from Ursus.

attributes.content: Here's the files on Chernobog, chief. They're on your desk.
attributes.name: Assistant

attributes.content: Hope you can find the info you wanted somewhere in those dusty papers.
attributes.name: Assistant

attributes.content: Thanks for sorting them out, Zhenya.
attributes.name: Editor

attributes.content: The assistant closes the door as he leaves, as usual. It scrapes against the uneven flooring, letting out a shrieking sound.
The editor sits up straight, lights a cigarette, and pushes through the discomfort as he flips through the stack of old newspapers.
'The Third Army's Dereliction of Duty in the Chernobog Incident...'
attributes.name: Editor

attributes.content: Tch... Same old, same old. 'Chernobog Closes Mine—a Heavy Blow to Ursus's Originium Industry'.
attributes.name: Editor

attributes.content: ...'Novochernobog—The Infected Lives a Blessed Life Under His Majesty's Glory'.
attributes.name: Editor

attributes.content: Utter drivel.
attributes.name: Editor

attributes.content: No, this isn't what I want... These trashy tabloids are barely scratching the surface.
attributes.name: Editor

attributes.content: ...None of these reports are anywhere close to the truth.
attributes.name: Editor

attributes.content: The editor pushes up his glasses and flicks away some stray cigarette ash, but accidentally sends sparks flying onto the paper.
He rushes to extinguish the sudden fire, but the newspaper already bears a freshly burnt hole.
Through the hole the editor sees an ensemble of letters—'Reunion'.
A name he has never heard of before.
In the last few days, a stream of Infected have been showing up wanting to join Reunion.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I told them we'll be leaving Londinium in one month's time, heading for the Duke of Gododdin's territory.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Are they willing to follow us there?
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: They neither agreed nor refused. They couldn't come up with an answer.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: ...I'll prepare for bringing them along. They have nowhere else to go.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Gododdin. I hear the Duke's issued more than a few decrees benefiting the Infected, so it's worth checking out.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Decrees and reality are not the same thing.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Obviously. Which is why we need to see for ourselves.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: From a corner comes a rustling sound as Ch'en turns a newspaper page.
Nothing to say even after listening in for so long, Ch'en?
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Everything you've talked about is internal business.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: As an outsider, I have no right to comment. I've been focusing on the news anyway.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: You weren't this quiet with many of the others in private.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: We need your thoughts, Hui-chieh.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: When I let you tag along with us, it wasn't just to show you how different we are from the other organizations.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Don't go getting the idea that you'd have to take responsibility for either of us.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Given our current situation, anyone's input is welcome, as long as we can help these people out. So speak your mind.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: You're planning to take in people with nowhere else to go?
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Why not?
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: They'll bring new vitality to our group.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Or new conflicts.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: This group you've gathered under the banner of what you're calling 'Reunion' is as rag-tag as they come.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Is this what you promised me when you left?
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Not to mention her.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Ch'en looks toward the indifferent Talulah.
You're bound to attract more eyes in future.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: So if you ask me, I suggest staying in Londinium for a while, and restructuring yourselves—
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: You mean letting someone more suitable handle it?
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: I won't deny that.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Just look at the people you have here. Criminals, Infected, deserters... Do you have a clue where you're taking them?
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: We're not going to stay here forever, at the very least.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: What is it? What's the hurry?
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Nine, Red just came back with some urgent news. Ugh—
attributes.name: Reunion Warrior

attributes.content: He shoots a glance at Ch'en.
Ever since the stranger called Ch'en showed up, his companions have been behaving strangely.
She rarely leaves Talulah and Nine alone, but has never once commented on Reunion's actions either.
Go on. She's one of us.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Troops from the ducal alliance are approaching the factory. Should we get them to leave?
attributes.name: Reunion Warrior

attributes.content: Ducal troops? They can't be coming for us, but... I'll head there myself and see what's going on.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Talulah... keep everyone else hidden.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Alright.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: So, you agree with Nine's methods?
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: ...Not exactly. But this group is nothing like the original group I traveled with on the tundra.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Unfortunately, oppressed peoples are treated the same way no matter where they are.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: No one cares where we go, Hui-chieh, only where we decide to stop. And then they'll figure out how to drive us away.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: 'Reunion'. It's a mistake I've made myself...
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Nine has no intention of wiping my slate clean, but if she needs me to come up with a new meaning—
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I have no right to refuse.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: And her conscience is crystal clear.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Nine... and myself, we know very well what we're doing.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: But you, Hui-chieh. You chased me—or rather, Reunion—all the way here.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Why are you still delaying what you decided long ago?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Talulah leaves. Ch'en doesn't catch up with her.
Keep moving, you beasts. Don't stop!
attributes.name: Alliance Soldier

attributes.content: Tch... Bloody bastards!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Civilian

attributes.content: Get up! Now!
attributes.name: Angry Alliance Soldier

attributes.content: Look at these disgusting sick freaks. Wish I could just get rid of them here and now.
attributes.name: Angry Alliance Soldier

attributes.content: The Exemplars' territory is just ahead. Are you considering dumping our rubbish right on their doorstep?
attributes.name: Cold Alliance Soldier

attributes.content: I say we stay out of trouble. They've already set up garbage disposal stations, so no littering.
attributes.name: Cold Alliance Soldier

attributes.content: Garbage disposal...?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Civilian

attributes.content: I won't ask when or where you got your orders, soldier.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: But this is no place for an execution.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Ah, the Infected hiding in the factory.
attributes.name: Cold Alliance Soldier

attributes.content: You should be thankful that we're busy catching these devils instead of—
attributes.name: Cold Alliance Soldier

attributes.content: The air grows warm. Nine casts a quick glance toward a corner shrouded in darkness.
Within it, a fire ignites, then slowly dims.
You... Did you just feel a tingling on your skin, like—
attributes.name: Angry Alliance Soldier

attributes.content: Like I got burned by fire.
attributes.name: Cold Alliance Soldier

attributes.content: ...Itching for a fight, huh?
attributes.name: Cold Alliance Soldier

attributes.content: This factory area is under the Exemplars' protection.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: So why don't you go ask your superiors if they'd mind an idiotic subordinate stirring up conflict here and smashing this hard-won peace to pieces?
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: I think you'll know how to speak to us after that.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: But suppose our allies, our 'friends', were to show inappropriate sympathy and compassion towards our common enemy—
attributes.name: Cold Alliance Soldier

attributes.content: I imagine my superiors would be humming a different tune.
attributes.name: Cold Alliance Soldier

attributes.content: Move, Infected.
attributes.name: Cold Alliance Soldier

attributes.content: ...They don't sound like they came from Kazdel.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Devils are freakishly good at disguises.
attributes.name: Cold Alliance Soldier

attributes.content: There's no way we're letting a devil merc slide past us.
attributes.name: Cold Alliance Soldier

attributes.content: Get moving, you damned devils!
attributes.name: Angry Alliance Soldier

attributes.content: Ugh...
attributes.name: Sarkaz Civilian

attributes.content: The squad escorting the Sarkaz slowly trudge through the long street, though both captors and captives look exhausted and numb.
Nine watches as they leave, and spots a few teenagers stumbling at the end of the downcast parade of prisoners.
Bastards...
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Here's the place, sir. The blaze lasted for three days and left basically nothing behind.
attributes.name: Local Villager

attributes.content: Did the fire spread anywhere other than the Patrol Unit's outpost?
attributes.name: News Reporter

attributes.content: No... but many miners seized the chance to escape. Everyone was so scared... Didn't know when the Patrol Unit would arrive...
attributes.name: Local Villager

attributes.content: But seems like you got here first. You said you're a reporter? But who's to say for sure?
attributes.name: Local Villager

attributes.content: ...Let's not get into that. So, if the management here has always been hard on everyone, how did the miners carry out the arson?
attributes.name: News Reporter

attributes.content: The miners?
attributes.name: Local Villager

attributes.content: No, no. The village had an old noble from the city, good heart, that man... but a bit too kindhearted, if you ask me.
attributes.name: Local Villager

attributes.content: Couldn't stand what was happening in the mines, always talking about rescuing the miners. We thought it was all talk, but in the end...
attributes.name: Local Villager

attributes.content: He really went and did it.
attributes.name: Local Villager

attributes.content: Oh? Then where is he now?
attributes.name: News Reporter

attributes.content: Must've died in the blaze with the Patrol Unit.
attributes.name: Local Villager

attributes.content: Hah. A noble who bravely sacrificed his life to help the suffering Infected miners.
attributes.name: News Reporter

attributes.content: That would make a pretty good headline.
attributes.name: News Reporter

attributes.content: The reporter gazes at the scorched land. Nearby buildings have been reduced to rubble, and in place of the once lush forest stands unsightly tree stumps.
Suddenly, a scorch mark draws his attention. It looks unusual, almost aesthetically pleasing.
Do you... know who left this mark here?
attributes.name: News Reporter

attributes.content: That's just from the fire.
attributes.name: Local Villager

attributes.content: I'm not buying that. It looks like a 'symbol' to me.
attributes.name: News Reporter

attributes.content: So—who left it here?
attributes.name: News Reporter

attributes.content: Uh... no clue. It was just here after the fire.
attributes.name: Local Villager

attributes.content: So you're saying it was a deliberate act, an attempt to send out a signal: 'Salvation'.
attributes.name: News Reporter

attributes.content: A-Am I?
attributes.name: Local Villager

attributes.content: (Laughs) Didn't you just explain the real history behind it for me?
attributes.name: News Reporter

attributes.content: No need to rush. Get in line, everyone will get some.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: How much longer do we have to stay here, Miss Ch'en?
attributes.name: Weary Sarkaz

attributes.content: When will the next squad leave the city...?
attributes.name: Weary Sarkaz

attributes.content: Don't worry. You're safe here.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: I've reached out through many different channels to get everyone out of here.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: I-I heard the Sarkaz-hunting soldiers have found this place.
attributes.name: Weary Sarkaz

attributes.content: If they find out you're sheltering us...
attributes.name: Weary Sarkaz

attributes.content: Sheltering? Why speak as if you're fugitives on the run?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: You're citizens of Londinium, victims of this war.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: We were already unwelcome long before the Sarkaz troops entered the city.
attributes.name: Weary Sarkaz

attributes.content: Believe me, it's more than just soldiers on that team.
attributes.name: Weary Sarkaz

attributes.content: Being a Sarkaz is already a crime, the worst one you can commit. Doesn't matter if you took part in the war or not.
attributes.name: Weary Sarkaz

attributes.content: ...I know.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Anyways... Thanks for taking us in.
attributes.name: Weary Sarkaz

attributes.content: I ironed it out with the others. We'll wait three days for a chance to leave the city. If we don't get one, we'll go by ourselves.
attributes.name: Weary Sarkaz

attributes.content: It's not the best time to leave. The soldiers have been even more active recently.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: All the more reason to get out as soon as we can. Every day we put it off will only worsen the situation.
attributes.name: Weary Sarkaz

attributes.content: ...If you insist, we'll help you out.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Appreciate the generosity. I suggest you guys do the same.
attributes.name: Weary Sarkaz

attributes.content: Who do you think they'll target next, once the city's out of Sarkaz?
attributes.name: Weary Sarkaz

attributes.content: Most of you are Infected. You should know how their nobles treat you guys.
attributes.name: Weary Sarkaz

attributes.content: Today's paper, sir.
attributes.name: Waiter

attributes.content: Hmm... I can't be bothered to read it, Alyosha. Anything noteworthy?
attributes.name: Carefree Noble

attributes.content: New tax policies, some literary works, a few scandals, and...
attributes.name: Waiter

attributes.content: And?
attributes.name: Carefree Noble

attributes.content: Revolts. All over the country.
attributes.name: Waiter

attributes.content: Let me see.
attributes.name: Carefree Noble

attributes.content: Finally, some real reporting. I thought those Deity Grypherburg reporters only knew how to run tabloids.
attributes.name: Carefree Noble

attributes.content: 'Infected have been striking at factories and outposts across the country. Some regions are experiencing a surge of uprisings, as Infected have brazenly attacked outposts and government agencies, causing serious losses...'
attributes.name: Carefree Noble

attributes.content: 'It is said that they are inspired by an Infected organization known as Reunion...'
attributes.name: Carefree Noble

attributes.content: Oh, look, they even left some symbols...
attributes.name: Carefree Noble

attributes.content: ...Do you wish to end your convalescence now?
attributes.name: Waiter

attributes.content: Of course not. Do you even realize how hard it is for me to get a vacation?
attributes.name: Carefree Noble

attributes.content: But your colleagues from the propaganda department have visited you many times already.
attributes.name: Waiter

attributes.content: Oh, my dear Alyoshenka, our dear nation has been suffering from a chronic disease for quite some time, and there are many who wish to heal her.
attributes.name: Carefree Noble

attributes.content: But to do so, these rotten old wounds must first see the light of day.
attributes.name: Carefree Noble

attributes.content: I've had enough of my colleagues patching them up, over and over.
attributes.name: Carefree Noble

attributes.content: How should I reply then?
attributes.name: Waiter

attributes.content: Tell them any discussion must wait until my vacation is over.
attributes.name: Carefree Noble

attributes.content: Did they ransack the streets again for another batch of prisoners? Here's your soup, Talulah.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: Thanks.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Too bland? Well—I had to ransack our stash to get the last of the salt.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: It's fine. Good, even.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Heh. 'Ransack'? That's a good word.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Only a week ago they wouldn't have come here, let alone taken any children among the prisoners.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: But we just saw both happen.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: They've been dead set on wiping out any trace of the Sarkaz for the past two weeks.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: At first, it was just Sarkaz soldiers who couldn't evacuate in time. Next, it was any Sarkaz civilian who had any dealings with the army. Now? Even Londinium-born Sarkaz aren't being spared.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I thought you'd make a move, Hui-chieh.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: ...That would only complicate things. We're in Victoria, so I have to act more cautiously.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: That'll only cost us more time.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: A few days ago I saw a group of kids harassing a poor woman... all she did was to marry a Sarkaz and raise their children together.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: This is how they treated the Infected before the war, and now it's the Sarkaz's turn. Eventually, every Londinium citizen will face this.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Time is what these mistreated people lack most.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Nine pauses to glance at Talulah right beside her.
However, she seems unusually calm, as if the sudden temperature increase earlier was just a hallucination.
I thought you'd make a move on the Victorians earlier.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: It was only a warning. It'd only bring us more trouble if we pestered them any further. Hui-chieh has a point—We should keep a low profile until we're forced to show ourselves.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Attacking ducal alliance troops on the factory streets certainly won't do anything to improve the lives of the workers here.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: So you weren't angry.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: What you're experiencing, I have too, long ago. But at least Sarkaz blood isn't contagious like Oripathy.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I've long since learned to control my rage. At the very least, I won't waste it on clueless underlings like the soldiers from before.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: This war has turned the oppressed into oppressors. It's not their fault.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Then who should the innocent Sarkaz vent their anger on?
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Remember that Sarkaz merchant with the motorbike who helped us get supplies...? The Infected killed him out of fear.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Now, that fear is spreading unchecked as the Sarkaz are gradually retreating.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Infected, soldiers, nobles... heh, even civilians who've never seen war. Everyone thinks they're in the right.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: So you're correct, Talulah. Sarkaz blood isn't contagious like Oripathy... but hatred and fear are.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: You've decided then?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: To save the Sarkaz? I see no need to hesitate. They're no different from us.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: I'm just not sure how to minimize the fallout, so I need your help.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Keep the people at camp safe, as well as the workers.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: ...If you need my flames to burn for them, I won't hesitate.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Red, let the workers know our plan. Those willing to join us can stay; anyone too afraid to escape, bring them to the Exemplars' camp.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Got it.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: Ch'en.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: You can try to stop us, or you can leave and pretend nothing happened.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Saving those Sarkaz means you'll have to change everything you've planned.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: And if you go with them, none of the Dukes will let you stay long in their domain, Nine.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: They won't let us stay long anyway, even without those people.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: We're Infected, Ch'en. Maybe your time at Rhodes Island has made you forget how we're actually treated.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Then where will you go next?
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: So you agree with our plan?
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Even prisoners shouldn't be executed so hastily. They don't even have an official order.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Hui-chieh, the issue isn't where Nine and the others want to go, but where they're needed.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: We'll find a place that truly needs us, Ch'en.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Not just the Infected... Anyone enslaved or deprived of their right to a fair chance at survival.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: A place with no discrimination or oppression.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: ...You know as well as the rest of us that that'll be difficult, if not impossible, Nine.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Of course. But this is the path a man we all knew left us before he died.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Guard...
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Someone has to see it through, Hui-chieh.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: This new Reunion makes their own medicine and strives to help anyone in need, without asking for anything tangible in return.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Change is happening, but it's too fragile.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: They need something to believe in, an objective. That's the only way they can push forward.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I don't completely agree with Nine's way of doing things, but I see no reason to refuse to cooperate either.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: She's always admired the 'fairness' you seek, Hui-chieh.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: So why not take a look at what she seeks?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: On the tundra ignored by the Emperor's edict, rebel activity has intensified, with thousands of Infected banding together to break their shackles and regain their freedom.
attributes.name: Anonymous Radio

attributes.content: We've achieved what used to be unthinkable.
attributes.name: Anonymous Radio

attributes.content: Ever since that first fire ignited by that anonymous noble, many of us have been communicating in hushed tones: Is there someone leading us? To be honest, I'm not too sure myself.
attributes.name: Anonymous Radio

attributes.content: What I do know is that our call to rise up has not been silenced, and is even now trying to escape from the tundra and its army of trees blocking the way.
attributes.name: Anonymous Radio

attributes.content: Our proof is that unique symbol everyone's curious about, the symbol scorched by flame.
attributes.name: Anonymous Radio

attributes.content: The hoarse voice on the radio smashes the countryside's peace apart.
People open their doors or climb onto their windowsills, listening quietly.
The broadcast excites them, their palms feeling hot even though they live in a place with temperatures far below zero.
Then, they light up torches in the center of the village. The light illuminates their eyes, and warms the bodies underneath their thin layers of clothing.
Soon, nearby villages spot the firelight and start bonfires one after the other.
On the dark tundra, countless fires light up the night sky.
We gather on this inhospitable tundra, following in their footsteps to take root here.
attributes.name: Anonymous Radio

attributes.content: Everyone has heard of the group that disappeared into Chernobog to fight for the Infected: 'Reunion'.
attributes.name: Anonymous Radio

attributes.content: Have they heard our call?
attributes.name: Anonymous Radio

attributes.content: Have they finally returned—
attributes.name: Anonymous Radio

attributes.content: Alrighty, you dregs! Turn around!
attributes.name: Executioner Soldier

attributes.content: Sir... please... spare my life, please...
attributes.name: Frightened Youth

attributes.content: I was born here!
attributes.name: Frightened Youth

attributes.content: I-I'm different from the rest, sir, please!
attributes.name: Frightened Youth

attributes.content: I said, shut it!
attributes.name: Executioner Soldier

attributes.content: S-Sir, please...
attributes.name: Frightened Youth

attributes.content: Kid, he doesn't give a damn who you are. He just wants to kill every Sarkaz he sees.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Civilian

attributes.content: Shut up!
attributes.name: Executioner Soldier

attributes.content: The boy suddenly smells a strange scent. It makes him recall his mother's perfume as she hugged him.
Countless flowers bloom on the bloodstained floors, and the scent grows stronger.
The executioner suddenly coughs violently until he throws up a cluster of bloody flower buds.
Ugh... *cough* *cough*...
attributes.name: Executioner Soldier

attributes.content: Y-You...
attributes.name: Frightened Youth

attributes.content: Get them out of here. Our people will know what to do.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: You lot... don't... *cough*...
attributes.name: Executioner Soldier

attributes.content: Nine! Stop your Originium Arts!
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: You already saved the Sarkaz! Killing them... is a step too far.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Couldn't you have just kept silent as usual, Ch'en?
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Stop making more enemies everywhere you go, unless you want the Dukes chasing after Reunion once you leave the city.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Talulah can make sure that it looks like an accidental blaze.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: No. They'll only put the blame on the Sarkaz, calling it an act of revenge.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: And then what? Who will the Dukes turn their gaze to? More innocent Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Or, say, an Infected group wandering around Victoria with who-knows-how-many Sarkaz in tow.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Letting them go will only make things worse.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Tell me, Ch'en. When we finally come face to face with the ducal alliance with no chance at escape, how will you keep the Infected and innocent Sarkaz there safe?
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Ugh...
attributes.name: Executioner Soldier

attributes.content: Enough! There're still other ways!
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: The tip of Ch'en's sword touches Nine's throat.
I've imagined this happening countless times.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: In fact, I'm shocked it didn't happen sooner.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: I went to school with many of their superior officers. I can talk to them.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: As what? As a former senior inspector of the L.G.D.? As Operator Ch'en of Rhodes Island? Or, what... an old classmate, reminiscing about the good old days?
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: ...I can guarantee these Sarkaz will be safe, at least.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Of course, I trust you'll keep that promise.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: But you're missing my point, Ch'en.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: There are limits to one person's power. Even you can't help the people you can't see.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: I know your capabilities all too well, and that's exactly why I'm even more sure that your momentary kindness won't change a thing. It can't.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: What I need is people willing to follow us, to see with their own eyes what we have to do.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Spare me the sophistry, Nine.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: I'm only looking at the facts.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: 'Sophistry', huh?
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Maybe we're all seeking 'fairness', but our interpretations of it are different.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: ...This is why I've long since given up hope of you coming to understand me and the future I'm looking forward to.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: You can most certainly try to arrest me, Officer Ch'en.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Chi Xiao stays in place, and Nine's gaze remains on Ch'en.
A flaming sword shakes Chi Xiao away.
This isn't the place to wax nostalgic about your old days on the force.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Talulah stabs her longsword into the ground, separating the all-tensed-up two.
I didn't call for your help, Talulah. Don't act like you know everything better.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Nine, there is nothing wrong with Hui-chieh's idea.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: The Dukes would be overjoyed at someone volunteering to remove every last Sarkaz from Londinium, and they might not make any moves on us.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: But more importantly, there are still eyes on the both of you.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: They only care about one thing: where should they go now?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: The rescued Sarkaz and the Reunion members following Nine are both terrified. They have no idea what to do next.
Many of them can't understand exactly what it is you want, Nine. They just want to live.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: They need time. It might take a while to show them the future you see.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Of course I know that.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: I have the patience to wait for my 'sophistry' to bloom into a concrete plan of action.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: And will you achieve that with even more sacrifices? How do you decide who?
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: ENOUGH!
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I'm not here to determine which of you is right or wrong. It's not my place to.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: But for now, just take them away from here. Take everyone who's willing to leave the city with us.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Hui-chieh might manage to prevent the Victorians from harassing us in the short term, but we'll still have to prepare for the worst.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Are you giving me an order, Talulah?
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: No, I'm offering my opinion.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: But where can you go?
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Your identities are too conspicuous.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Is this where you say we should go to Rhodes Island?
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Yes. I have to see the both of you judged.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: But not right now. Many Infected are still relying on you, and I can't just leave them in the dust.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Hah... Classic Officer Ch'en.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Want my opinion?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Whenever Talulah proactively offers her thoughts to Nine, it often leaves the Phidia with even more doubts towards her.
But Talulah has never fallen behind.
She always walks silently in the center of their group, so inconspicuous that people forget she exists.
Reunion's leader, Kashchey's adopted daughter, and the manipulative mastermind behind the Chernobog disaster.
Talulah, regarded as a hero by Infected who do not know the truth.
Her sword begins to burn, and its flames spread across the floor. They jump and fall, outlining a symbol.
The firelight reflects in the trio's eyes, but their faces still bear some gloom—the mark once represented a dark past.
Within it hides all sorts of crimes and injustices, certain to sting if revealed for all to see.
Ursus.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: We can go back to Ursus.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: ...That's a terrible idea.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: What, thinking about your unfinished business over there?
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: No, I want to right my wrongs.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I've received news from Ursus. The Infected are breaking their shackles and congregating on the tundra again.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: They claim to be answering the call of Reunion, and have decided to stand up and fight for the rights and freedoms the Infected and other oppressed deserve.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: They were inspired by a lie, but their determination to fight back is certainly real.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: So they gave you the courage to recall the good old days?
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: ...It's not only Infected over there. There are students, exiled officers and soldiers, guilt-ridden nobles...
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: It's exactly the strength you need.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Strength that ignores the differences in race or identity and crushes the fear of disease, united by a common goal.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Besides, it'll take time to leave with this many people... and I think that should be long enough for you to explain Guard's precious dream to those still willing to follow you.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: ...You don't want to restore Reunion's reputation?
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: No. I never expected it to hold such a large influence even today.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Even if the Ursus Empire has long since covered up what happened at Chernobog.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: The voices craving resistance are like water. They might be burnt and dry up, but they'll eventually return to the land as rain.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Returning to Ursus is easier said than done. There are too many factors involved, and more things for me to confirm.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: That's your problem. Not ours.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Talulah...
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Even if Reunion can turn a new leaf, representing once again freedom and happiness...
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: What about you, Talulah? Your sins can't be washed away. Your existence is Reunion's darkest history.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: How can you face the pure-white tundra as you are?
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: I know that I stand here today no longer as a leader, but as a symbol, a flag, or even... a weapon to be wielded.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: But I'll take it. I'll accept the shackles you place on me. I've had many different identities—Draco, noble, leader, Infected... None of these matter anymore.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Today I remain only someone who once scattered the seeds of sin.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: The wrongs I committed in Ursus, I will repay in Ursus.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Repay... you make it sound so simple.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: I will not act as just a flag this time.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Then how?
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: I'll throw myself into a true blaze and let it all burn, until even the tundra's chill melts away.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I'll go back to Ursus... to truly face my own trial.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: And you can be there to witness it, Nine.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Witness the end of Reunion, and the birth of something new from its corpse. That's what you truly want, is it not?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: You really don't mind?
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: The Reunion of my heart died long ago on the tundra... along with my companions.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I'll go with you.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Scared I'll harm more innocents?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Both you and Nine.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: After following Reunion for a while, I can confirm that the group has changed somewhat.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: For good or bad... I can't say.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: I don't want to miss your trial, but I also don't want to jump to any hasty conclusions about whether the path Nine insists on is correct.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: From now on, I'll keep an eye on you as Rhodes Island Operator Ch'en.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: I need to keep Rhodes Island informed, no matter what happens in Ursus.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Talulah, Nine... I'm responsible for you both.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: ...Whatever.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Now, you should probably get going. Leave the soldiers to me. I'll catch up after I make sure they're okay.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: We didn't say we'd wait for you.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Have you ever? I've always had to catch up on my own.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Hmph.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Onwards to Ursus then.
attributes.name: Nine

attributes.content: Onwards to Ursus.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: The flames continue to spread slowly from the tip of the blade.
Hot flames lick the bodies piled up in a corner, gently enveloping them.
Amid the light crackling of the fire, Talulah silently prays for the flames to bring them to a brighter and warmer place.
